title: `x.py clippy` doesn't work on Windows

labels.name: T-bootstrap
labels.description: Relevant to the bootstrap subteam: Rust's build system (x.py and src/bootstrap)

body:
`x.py clippy` doesn't work on Windows.
I double checked and my default toolchain is set to `nightly` and the `clippy` component is installed.
However I get the following error message when running `x.py clippy` on Windows:
```
error: `x.py clippy` requires a host `rustc` toolchain with the `clippy` component
help: try `rustup component add clippy`
```
The error message seems to be really misleading.
As you can tell from the [source code](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/bc8ad24020a160e1acd7ac9f7671947dcc01264c/src/bootstrap/builder.rs#L962), it actually failed to run `rustc --version`.
The `host_version` (`Command::output()` of `rustc --version`) looks like this:
```
Ok(
    Output {
        status: ExitStatus(
            ExitStatus(
                101,
            ),
        ),
        stdout: "",
        stderr: "thread 'main' panicked at 'RUSTC_STAGE was not set: NotPresent', src\\bootstrap\\bin/rustc.rs:47:41\nnote: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace\n",
    },
)
```

### Meta
`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.57.0-nightly (54bb4fec6 2021-10-08)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 54bb4fec68cb592e23077896baea072919721573
commit-date: 2021-10-08
host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc
release: 1.57.0-nightly
LLVM version: 13.0.0
```
